arm_group.description: Ingestion of 250 mg capsle (Coleus forskohlii extract) twice a day for 12 weeks
Ingestion of 250 mg capsule (placebo) twice a day for 12 weeks

brief_summary.textblock:
Coleus forskohlii extract contains the bioactive compound, forskolin. Preliminary studies
      have shown that forskolin can increase fat metabolism thus reduce fat accumulation in both
      animals and humans. It has been suggested that forskolin may also suppress appetite thus
      reduce energy intake and results in weight loss. This study will evaluate the appetite
      suppressant properties of Coleus forskohlii extract. In addition the effect on central
      obesity and risk factors of metabolic syndrome will also be investigated.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Effect of Coleus Forskohlii Extract on the Risk Factors of Metabolic Syndrome

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Both Australian males and females, age 20-60 years, Overweight or obese (BMI >25),
             waist circumference of > 94 cm (male), waist circumference of >80 cm (female)

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Cigarette smoker, hypertension, all types of heart, liver and kidney disease,
             pregnancy, lactating, Type 1 diabetes and weight loss medication.

intervention.description: Ingestion of 250 mg Coleus forskohlii extract capsule twice a day for 12 weeks
Ingestion of 250 mg placebo capsule twice a day for 12 weeks

facility.name: College of Health and Biomedicine Victoria University

clinical_study.official_title: Investigation of Appetite Suppressant Properties Associated With Coleus Forskohlii in Overweight and Obese Individuals

other_outcome.measure: alterations in blood lipids. This will be measured using commercial kits

oversight_info.authority: Australia: National Health and Medical Research Council

primary_outcome.measure: changes in appetite will be assessed using visual analogue scale; blood hormone levels will also be measured using commercial kits.

reference.citation: Shivaprasad HN, Gopalakrishna S, Mariyanna B, Thekkoot M, Reddy R, Tippeswamy BS. Effect of Coleus forskohlii extract on cafeteria diet-induced obesity in rats. Pharmacognosy Res. 2014 Jan;6(1):42-5. doi: 10.4103/0974-8490.122916.

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.measure: reduction in central obesity - waist circumference will be measured on fortnight basis

collaborator.agency: College of Health and Biomedicine, Victoria University

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Double Blind (Subject, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor), Primary Purpose: Prevention
